website_summaries.verdict: The best value robot cleaner from ILIFE geared for use on hard flooring like wood and tile.
pros: The vacuum uses a more powerful, more robust motor to suck up more challenging debris
Can handle pet hair and and stains by mopping up hardwood floors
cons: Limited tank doesn't distribute the water uniformly

customer_reviews.title: We love this lil guy!
customer_reviews.text: We love this vacuum! We named him Vinny! I turn him on just about every day when I’m getting ready for the day or doing stuff around the house and it makes it so easy to keep up on pet hair around the house. He is great for hardwood, tile, or carpet. He has a prett great battery life and will automatically re-dock to charge. The only downside is the dust compartment is pretty small so you have to empty it after every use. It’s super easy to empty and clean though.
customer_reviews.author: Paige

customer_reviews.title: Doesn’t work at all
customer_reviews.text: I asked for this as a birthday and Christmas gift and what a dud it turned out to be. As a working mother of 3, I just needed something to help me sweep up a little but this appliance was a waste of money. It doesn’t pick up anything and it just rolls over the small particles and keeps going. I would like to return it honestly. Maybe I chose a bad model, but this one I cannnot recommend to anyone.
customer_reviews.author: Ezinwanyi

customer_reviews.title: Not so intelligent
customer_reviews.text: 1 star for the mopping ability. Note in the description that it cleans "randomly". It doesn't map your home. The robot spent 40 minutes running around in half of my living room. Also it doesn't connect to your phone which means you can't control it over voice assistant. And I don't know for how long it keeps cleaning. Maybe when the battery runs out. You can't seems to stop the schedule once it's set because there is no button on the remote to do it. Yes all these are mentioned in the description, but my point is that there are other robots that do all that and only cost like $30 more. I wish I got a different one...
customer_reviews.author: Runze

customer_reviews.title: Amazing Little Robot!
customer_reviews.text: We are blown away by this little machine. It is a bit weak in the mopping aspect, but we purchased it more to keep up with the vacuuming with 3 kids and a puppy during the day. It leaves my floors SPOTLESS and feeling clean. I like to keep our home very clean, and I am always shocked by what the robot has suctioned into the tray after each clean. It gets under counters, tables, and places that the larger vacuum cannot. It is also really cute to watch. We did a lot of research before this purchase, and this has yet to disappoint. Even with the mopping aspect being minimal, it is the greatest value out there!
customer_reviews.author: Fisher Bunch

customer_reviews.title: Quit working after a couple of months
customer_reviews.text: Had it for 6 months and it literally just up and quit working. Turn it on (after it’s been charging for hours) and it literally just stops in the middle of the floor or gets “caught” under things that it used to go right under (tables/chairs/cribs). It won’t run for more than 2 minutes or so without messing up. BEYOND frustrated as I’ve bought THREE of them (for myself and other family members) and recommended them to like everyone I know.
customer_reviews.author: Kelsie Roberts

customer_reviews.title: Still need to sweep and mop after using
customer_reviews.text: This vacuum is okay to do minor cleaning, but I still feel dirt on the floor and it wont even pick up any dog food pieces that my dog has dropped. The dirt bin is real small, and the mop is absolutely awful. The mop barely empties out enough water to clean the floor and only leaves two streaks of water on the floor forcing me to mop the floor myself. I have had two other robot vacuums and this one is the worst
customer_reviews.author: Alicia Peloquin

customer_reviews.title: Battery Wont Hold A Charge, Cust Service Terrible
customer_reviews.text: We loved this vacuum - while it worked. All too quickly the battery quit holding a charge (even though we were meticulous about following the instructions/directions). We have been trying to get in contact with the company to send it back and have had terrible customer service which had resulted in the vacuum being a very expensive paperweight since about 8 weeks after we purchased it. Has customer service been better and had the battery not died, the rating would be a 5 but I can't justify a rating that high at all with it not working. It's a shame.
customer_reviews.author: A Osborn

customer_reviews.title: Love her
customer_reviews.text: I've had her maybe 9 months. You have to make sure you clean her sometimes or she'll start messing up. I like her on max mode all the time. It's annoying that she wanders aimlessly but if you run her twice she gets everything. She has problems finding her home sometimes. She gets stuck under the fridge and humps the scale until she turns off. You have to be really careful that there are no strings or weird stuff on the floor. She doesn't like wires but usually escapes them with a few tries. I'd buy it again any day. Oh... The mopping feature is completely useless. If thats your selling point, take it off your list.
customer_reviews.author: Kay Deezy

customer_reviews.title: Avoid! Avoid! Avoid! Barely lasted 1.5 years.
customer_reviews.text: So, after this thing continually found its way into every wire in my home and got stuck on said wire, it smeared dog feces around the house much to my wife’s dismay. So I cleaned it, sterilized it. It then sat for 3 months, plugged in and charging. We were nervous to use it again. But after my wife gave in and allowed its use again, it refused. It literally has power. It’s charged. Remote works. I have it’s timer set. Nothing. Just a little beep and no movement. So, it lasted two years and the past six months just idly waiting to be used. Avoid it. It’s cheap. Spend the $ and get a name brand.
customer_reviews.author: Josh C

customer_reviews.title: Fake Mopping
customer_reviews.text: It just drags around a microfiber rag while the base drips water. That's NOT mopping it's smearing dirt. It's REALLY quiet and that's a MASSIVE bonus. I already have an iRobot Roomba so I don't need quieter, I NEED MOPPING
customer_reviews.author: MsMichelleKlein

customer_reviews.title: Great Product/Great Value!!!
customer_reviews.text: We Love this Robot! Our $400 Roomba died after about 3 years of valiant use, and I purchased this one. The price is fantastic, and we are super pleased with the product. We are amazed at how much it picks up. We have a little dog that sheds, but this Robot sure picks everything up! It’s also a little smaller than our Roomba, and is able to go under our Couch, Chair, and Bathroom Vanity, none of which the Roomba could fit under! The Mopping Function is really great too, and everything is easy to operate. It’s very quiet also. I can’t imagine one could find a better product for the money!!!
customer_reviews.author: Joseph Turner

customer_reviews.title: Corrupted Software and Sensor Failures
customer_reviews.text: This robot worked reasonably well in hardwood floors for two years. The second year though it had to reset often because it began acting erratically. Never worked for carpets and rarely made it back to it's charging station. Recently the loaded software and sensors went on the fritz. My low rating is because I expect something like a robot vacuum to last for much longer than two years. It should have been produced with better components. I will never buy another ILIFE product again.
customer_reviews.author: Popcorn fan

customer_reviews.title: A year later...
customer_reviews.text: This is the best value I have ever had in a vacuum..I use it everyday to clean my shop....I have a 3000 sq. foot attached garage / shop and I run this vacuum every day sometimes 2x a day...My floors are clean...I have epoxy concrete floors and it is absolutely amazing. If it died tomorrow, I would be sad, but I would buy it again!!! It WORKS... Randy
customer_reviews.author: Randy F

customer_reviews.title: My helper
customer_reviews.text: I already have a robot vacuum that I love and thought...what the heck? Why not get the mopper as well? This is great for vacuuming as well as mopping. My other robot gets stuck under my baseboards, Ilife does not. Some reviews said it tumbles down steps. Mine has not. It stops and changes direction. The review prompt wants the reviewer to say if it is good for deep cleaning. It wet wipes, so it's a surface clean, but I mop every other day and I love how clean my floors are due to the frequency of mopping. I feel like I finally have a helper with the housework! Happy with my purchase!
customer_reviews.author: Christine F.

customer_reviews.title: Good but has some limitations
customer_reviews.text: I have an iRobot Roomba and bought the ILife for primarily mopping. The pros are that it does a good job mopping mid to small size areas. You do have to create barriers to keep it within the area you want to mop. Unlike Roomba it doesnt come with barriers. It does a fairly decent job mopping and doesn't smear. The cons are that it doesnt have a remote app to control the unit. It comes with a standard remote where you can program times to run and use directional buttons. Overall, it serves its purpose and for the price I am pleased.
customer_reviews.author: P.M.D.

customer_reviews.title: Works great on cat hair and Florida sand.
customer_reviews.text: Our Florida house is 1,200 square feet. All wood floor. We have 3 indoor outdoor cats. Alfred, we named the vacuum Alfred, gets all the sand and all the cat hair on a daily basis. I just set the timer on the remote. When I come home,I empty out the hopper. Unless I leave a sock on the floor. Alfred the vacuum doesn't like socks. It's nice to walk around in your bare feet not have sand for cat hair on them. We love Alfred. He has been cleaning our house almost a year now. Gave one to my father
customer_reviews.author: Gunny Z USMC

customer_reviews.title: Just an initial Impression...
customer_reviews.text: Ignore the star ratings above, they just had to have something, so I chose a neutral position. FIRST IMPRESSIONS: Be prepared for Engrish. The instructions require a lot of "what do they mean by that?" (if you know what I mean). For instance in the remote control instructions; "Press this button to decrease the number of scheduling." Number of what scheduling? Scheduling what??? I don't know yet. I'm currently online looking for a clear set of instructions on how to actually set the robot up.
customer_reviews.author: Lisa A Combest

customer_reviews.title: Two kids a shedding husky and a cat, and it picks up all the messes
customer_reviews.text: I love everything about this little mop/vacuum robot, I have two kids so I feel like I was spending a good part of my day cleaning up after them especially in the kitchen now I just put it in the room I need cleaned and stop worrying about cleaning up so much it’s been such a time saver for me the only thing bad about it is it sometimes gets stuck but I just check on it while it’s on and it’s fine, I have a kitty and a husky who sheds all the time and it gets all that hair up it’s pretty awesome little vacuum
customer_reviews.author: Allie Bobbitt

customer_reviews.title: Tumbling down the stairs it went....and the end.
customer_reviews.text: We had Robotico for about 4 months, it was working well, I was pretty happy with it until the cliff sensor stopped working and it went plummeting down the wooden staircase that the vacuum had previously sensed and until then always avoided. That was the end of Robotico. The parts popped off and we were able to put it back together pretty easily but it would no longer turn on or charge. I have to say that I am highly disappointed that this ~$200 product lasted 4 months. Simply go with another product.
customer_reviews.author: PERLA CORREDOR

customer_reviews.title: Duster picker upper in a robot
customer_reviews.text: I put this to the test, I swept my whole house then told me husband to sweep. Then we put this little robot on and it picked up so much dust and hair and little things we completely did not pick up with the normal broom. I put it on auto every night at 11 pm a little loud but not to bad & it does have a problem finding its way back home, other then that so glad a bought this.
customer_reviews.author: Nicole

customer_reviews.title: They will take care of you!
customer_reviews.text: I love the model Ilife4 so I had to try the Ilife5 for the mop features. It does the job but I would not recommend for deep cleaning if you have pets and very dirty wood floors. The best thing is I had an issue with the wheel and they took care of the broken unit and sent me a refurbished one that works just like new. Glad to buy from a company that honors their warranty. Cheers!
customer_reviews.author: Victor S.

customer_reviews.title: This thing is amazing at picking up dog hair and general dust/dirt.
customer_reviews.text: This is the 2nd one we buy. Got this one for my in-laws. Pros: -This thing is amazing at picking up dog hair and general dust/dirt. -It does a really nice job on our area rugs as well. -The price Cons: -It tends to get lost a bit, especially when returning to base. -Can suck up a drape, clothes, cable if you don't clear the floor. We love it. A friendly tip. If the bristles become mangled and twisted, just place them in some heated/boiled water. They'll go right back to their original shape.
customer_reviews.author: Askani

customer_reviews.title: Loved it and bought another one for my mother.
customer_reviews.text: Really liked it for every day cleaning. Battery lasts really long. The mopping also works really well for superficial cleaning. Don't expect it to remove hard stains obviously, but works pretty well for hairs and everything. Probably it has the same limitations than any other robot vacuum (ie, not good for carpets for example, could get stuck with certain things on the floor, etc), but for the price it's totally worth it.
customer_reviews.author: diegoj

customer_reviews.title: Viva is a BEAST!
customer_reviews.text: This joker is a beast! It will get across almost anything!! Climb on my bathroom rugs like a champ. My entire house is hardwood...sometimes it will hit the transition piecing between the room and come back but it will get back on track into that romm it might just take a couple seconds. It took about 4 days for the robot, "Viva" learned my house and now she goes everywhere. It fits under my kitchen cabinets and gets spaces that are hard to reach corners. I'd prefer this vac over other robots. I havent tried the mop mode yet but I bet it is just as great.
customer_reviews.author: Lori Swanson

customer_reviews.title: Our first robot vacuum
customer_reviews.text: I love it! We’ve used both the vacuum and mop option and our floors are looking lovely. We are a family of a pack of dog babies. So our floors take on high traffic. This little machine did it job and navigates through the first floor of the house with minor bumps. Gets under the couch and tv stand which is awesome. Zero complaints. Will update in the future.
customer_reviews.author: Christina

customer_reviews.title: Best brand, also furniture's are cleanner because picks the dust on the air.
customer_reviews.text: Great robot..it really cleans. I made random test. I cleaned my house and when I finished I turn on my Ilife V5 and let it clean again.. my surprise is that the trash space turn full. I think it also catches dust in the air, but is amazing. Filters are easy to get and is very quiet. After seeing its performance and also notice that dust in the house is 70% on furniture's, I bought Ilife V8S because I use one on each floors of my house. This brand is definitely great, also better than Roomba. I am very happy customer, and I feel my money is well spend on this.
customer_reviews.author: Ruth Morazan

customer_reviews.title: Lacks direction....
customer_reviews.text: We have used the V5S for basic 'dusting' of the wood floors. It does a fairly good job, and catches the majority of the dust and crumbs. However, the total random pattern has it going over the same areas many times, without any real need. Also, the constant circling prevents the cleaning on a timely basis. We do like the product, but it takes much too long to clean with the current movement. We can sweep and dust the floors much, much quicker.
customer_reviews.author: M. J. Fiola

customer_reviews.title: Vacuum yes Mop No
customer_reviews.text: It works as a vacuum but if you are in a hurry you’re gonna have to break out the old fashion vacuum. It is not effective as a mob at all which is the reason I purchased it but I will keep it because it does vacuum when I’m busy doing something else. The four-star is for the vacuum it does not pick up big items but it keeps running even if hair or paper clip gets tangled. it does pick up dirt, dust abd crumbs.
customer_reviews.author: SY

customer_reviews.title: Great for pet hair.
customer_reviews.text: I have 2 cats, it cleans up hair very well. It climbs obstacles like cords decently, but can suck up and get stuck on things like socks. It runs on a random path, which is fine for me, but it cant path back to its charger unless by chance it finishes near its charger, if it wanders to the hallway or kitchen and tries to return, it will seek the charger ineffectively until it dies - In hindsight for auto cleaning while im not home, I should have gotten one with smart mapping that goes back and forth until its covered the whole mappable area.
customer_reviews.author: John F. Epling

customer_reviews.title: Gets stuck on everything
customer_reviews.text: At first I liked this product, but over time it's just been annoying. The fall sensors don't stop it from jumping the one step I have, it has a tendency to climb things like shoes and get stuck, it wraps up anything you have like cables or socks you have on the floor in it's tries/brushes and gets stuck, and it's found a way to get stuck under my cabinets. It's worse when you put the mop on sometimes it thinks it's trapped in a small place and only mops a corner, or just decides it's stuck for no reason. I never had this many problems with the other robot I owned before this....
customer_reviews.author: kyle wiles

customer_reviews.title: Good-ish
customer_reviews.text: It’s very nice to set and walk away. It sucks up a lot of dirt, even after using an upright vacuum in the kitchen. BUT the navigation is terrible. It constantly just goes around the perimeter of the room, over and over and over. Only way to make it go somewhere else is to steer it with remote. But sometimes it doesn’t even listen to that. It completely avoids a 5ft radius around the home base. It spends 80% of the time cleaning 20% of the floor and 20% of the time cleaning 80% of the floor. The mop function works good too.
customer_reviews.author: Kyle Pvirre

customer_reviews.title: Makes life easier!
customer_reviews.text: I've been using this vacuum for about 8 months now, LOVE it!!! I bought when I was very pregnant with my 5th baby, and cleaning was hard! I use it mostly in the dining room and kitchen, because those need to be swept several times a day. I run it in the morning , then in the evening. I use the mop feature occasionally and it does ok. Works great at getting the dust bunnies from under the beds too!
customer_reviews.author: Bata

customer_reviews.title: Wish I could buy a better vacuum
customer_reviews.text: I chose this vacuum because it has both vacuum and mopping and the price is affordable. I wish I could spring for one of the nicer ones though. When the vacuum arrived, the brushes were all smooshed. I tried my best to straighten them out but I'm sure they are supposed to be in better shape. I'm not sure if this affects the cleaning abilities. I am not sure if the vacuum does a good job. It seems to just go in random places, missing some areas completely and vacuuming the crap out of other areas. I wil try it out for a little bit but if it does not do its job, I will have to return it.
customer_reviews.author: Olivia

customer_reviews.title: Somewhat smart vacuum
customer_reviews.text: When I first got the product it worked better, it’s been a few months now and I think it lost a few brain cells. It gets stuck on wall corners, chairs, doesn’t sense as well, goes full speed into a wall, etc. the vacuum is okay if you control it the entire time, and if you remove EVERYTHING from the floors hopefully it doesn’t have to get unstuck. I live in a studio apartment so it’s not a lot of room to cover. If you’re looking for a cheap robot vacuum that’ll somehow get the job done and are lazy, get this one. If you have a little more money to spend. Try getting a different one.
customer_reviews.author: Paula Enerson

customer_reviews.title: Great little gadget!
customer_reviews.text: Great product! I’ve used this twice a day for a week now and couldn’t be happier! It’s great for spot cleaning and it gets up just about everything. It’s one less chore I have to do daily. And as a mom of three, I’m constantly busy! I wish I would have invested in this product sooner! The only thing is you have to make sure any loose cords are out of the way or taped down to the floor because it will stop and get stuck on them. The first time using this, I watched to see which areas needed to be secured. Now there is no issues.
customer_reviews.author: Fireball

customer_reviews.title: UPDATE Works like a charm again.
customer_reviews.text: UPATE! Heard back from someone who called (he thinks first emails went to spam because they were from China). With this model sometimes the 6 screws are in too tight and after a while stops the sensor from working with the bumper. Was instructed to loosen them all about a turn. Works like a charm again. Stop sensing obstructions after 2 months and would just turn off every time it came across a piece of furniture. I contacted the stopped working after 2 months and the manufacturer won't replace or repair
customer_reviews.author: Cherryville Photography

customer_reviews.title: Not worth the money.
customer_reviews.text: This vacuum is fine. It misses a lot and spends way too much time in stupid places (under the couch for forever every time, weird corners, etc.) and yet it misses dirt in plain sight no matter how many times I start it. It gets caught up in every cord, on rugs and wedges itself under the couch, dishwasher, etc. The dirt it does get helps with having to use a real vacuum as often, but to me, it’s not worth the money.
customer_reviews.author: Stephanie Mac

customer_reviews.title: Well worth the price!!!
customer_reviews.text: Lives up to its description. It maneuvers well, got in and around, and out of some pretty complex and challenging areas, and varied surfaces. Didn’t even come close to falling down stairs. Picked up everything in its path until it got full, and then it didn’t which is completely understandable. It got hair and crumbs out of tight corners. The only thing I would change is put a larger recepticle in it since I have to stop it about three times during its journey to empty it if I haven’t run it for a week or so because both my dog and I are prolific at shedding hair! I definitely recommend this robot vacuum!
customer_reviews.author: Amanda Griffin

customer_reviews.title: Best money I've spent this year
customer_reviews.text: This product is absolutely lovely. It does a great job of sweeping and mopping my floors. It went outside (accidentally) one day, and also did a great job of sweeping my deck. It's consistent, has great vacuum, picks up off rugs and hard floors, and is very easy to maintain. I've had my machine for 4 months, and wouldn't change a thing.
customer_reviews.author: talina

customer_reviews.title: You won't regret it. I'm in love!
customer_reviews.text: I am OBSESSED and so grateful I took a chance and bought this. I haven't even used all the features yet but this helps's me so much and saves me so much time. It's fairly quite, will return to "home base" if it doesn't turn off being stuck and cleans out easily. I only wish the trash part was bigger but this is a totally keeper in my book! You'll be pleased with your purchase
customer_reviews.author: rAYMOND

customer_reviews.title: Great for Price
customer_reviews.text: This is a great option for the price as far as robot vacuums go. The bin that collects the dust always comes back full after a full cleaning job, so I know it’s picking up things. It’s really good for cleaning in between your normal vacuuming/sweeping. I like the mopping feature as well!! Like I said, it’s not going to replace your cleaning, but it makes me feel better about my kids crawling on the floor in between my cleanings. Also a bummer because it won’t clean my large living room rug - it’s black and has a busy pattern so that might be affecting its sensors. Other than that, very happy with this purchase.
customer_reviews.author: Eric&Rachel

customer_reviews.title: Okay
customer_reviews.text: Attached photos are items are come with the (we call it “little bender”) item. Pretty neat vacuum when you’re busy with work. Compared to my standards of cleaning, this thing does the minimum job of picking up dirt off hardwood floors.
customer_reviews.author: Donna

customer_reviews.title: You should buy a better model
customer_reviews.text: I thought I could deal with random issues of a budget model, and I don't have a ton of carpet, etc... I have mostly hardwood floors, and ONE of my rugs is a little thicker, not a "thick rug" by any means... and this thing will be totally unable to get across it, it just stops dead in the middle of the rug like the terrain was too challenging for it..
customer_reviews.author: Jesse F.

customer_reviews.title: Warranty
customer_reviews.text: Very easy to use and gets the job done, glad that I had extended warranty. Because it stop working at month 3 exactly. The right side wheel motor stopped working. Great customer service, returned the one and waiting for the new one to arrive. It surely keeps your home clean every day. Great for hair and dust removal. I do love the machine bug question the durability. But the extended warranty just in case.
customer_reviews.author: Danny Toledo Moreno

customer_reviews.title: Perfect for parents
customer_reviews.text: Love it! Got it for parents who need help with cleaning. This helps keep their floors clean the way they like without all the extra work. Just turn it on and let it do its thing while they sit back and watch Tv.., The mop is like a swiffer on the floor but again i love it and it's perfect for them. It's a soft cloth wiping the floor with water. No chemicals. They can do the heavy mopping once a week oppose to 2-3 times a week due to daily traffic in the house. I can gift this to a few family members for sure :)
customer_reviews.author: CarmN

customer_reviews.title: Mop feature not worth the money
customer_reviews.text: I bought this to clean our cabin after weekend trips with the dogs. It picks up lots of dog fur and fills the collection bin pretty quick. That's easy to dump and send back out to work. It would prefer if it indicated the bin was full, rather than continuing about the room not really picking up more stuff. The mop feature doesn't put down enough water to do much. The microfiber doesn't get wet enough to do more than smear stuff around.
customer_reviews.author: Melissa Kendall

customer_reviews.title: Does the job.
customer_reviews.text: Overall its good. But not the best. Biggest problem i see is its not able to go back to its charging station easily. If it loses charge at one end of the house you will have to pick it up it wont be able to go to its station. Other than that it does the job. You may have to have the remote and navigate it sometime because it will miss a spot. For the price i think its ok. Its a good huy not the best buy for me.
customer_reviews.author: sandeep s.

customer_reviews.title: Random and lacking in cleanup
customer_reviews.text: This thing is loud. I didn't realize but there is no brush under it, only the front little side ones. Doesn't have memory just randomly bumps around. Gets almost stuck on rugs on tile. Got a tangled in long drapes. Pros: Its cute and fun to watch. It slows down and gently bumps things.
customer_reviews.author: Jeremy Swartwood

customer_reviews.title: The vacuum feature works like a champ!
customer_reviews.text: I call him Stevie, you know, like Little Stevie Wonder; he can't see but he gets around fine and does what he need to do. The mop function, not so great. It has a kind of low-pile carpet pad that attaches to the bottom and a water dispenser to place inside the machine. I have one year old marble looking plank floor tiles from Lowe's which have a slight texture. The battery seem to last a long time; however, charging seems to last a long time too!
customer_reviews.author: Lane Maeve Alison

customer_reviews.title: So sad!!
customer_reviews.text: Omg! I loved this darned thing. Totally changed my life with two cats. The cat fur and torn up toys, feathers, cardboard was magically cleaned every single day. My place looked sooooo much cleaner all the time. It didn’t work as well on carpet and would sometimes leave bits of junk on the edge of a carpet or rug... still was totally worth it. And then suddenly one of the wheels stopped working!!! It just turns around in a circle! I am sooooo disappointed! I NEED this thing to keep up ok it’s game! ☹️☹️☹️☹️😋
customer_reviews.author: Christy Whitten

customer_reviews.title: It could have gitten a five
customer_reviews.text: The machine works well, exceeding my expectations except for one thing that kept it from getting five stars, and that's an utter lack of any documentation except a one page quick start guide. I found a PDF manual for it on the internet that wasn't much better than the PDF, which was written in "pigeon English". I couldn't figure out to remove the hopper, being afraid of breaking it. After not having my support email returned in two days I tried pulling on it hard, that should have been in the abysmal manual. I still haven't heard back from tech support. Again, I'm very happy with the sweeper and greatly frustrated by its lack of useful documentation.
customer_reviews.author: Steve McGrew

customer_reviews.title: Barely make the job
customer_reviews.text: This robot vacuum looks great and it works for small areas without many dusts, but it is under power in terms of suction and the mopping process not worth the time... you will need to use a mop anyway. My suggestion is that you expend more money on a better vacuum robot. Anyway for a first try on this kind of product it allows me to want a better one but not this one.
customer_reviews.author: smartin

customer_reviews.title: Works way better than expected
customer_reviews.text: This thing is AMAZING. Nothing better than a new toy to plan with. I know its faster if I do it myself but what fun is that. I get to supervise and make sure it does its job right..hahaha Works great on hardwood floors and tile. Mop mode doesn't replace a good scrub once a week but it maintains daily especially for young kids. Highly recommend
customer_reviews.author: Reginator

customer_reviews.title: vacuums great
customer_reviews.text: This little guy definitely does a great job sweeping/vacuuming! I have a Roomba (it is several years old) but the ilife seems to do a better job when sweeping/vacuuming. Cons: the dustpan is small. As far as the mopping option, its not great. Its fine for a small area (10x10) but for anything larger, it just doesn't cut it. I have an open concept of about 600 sqft and the mopping option is pointless in such a large area.
customer_reviews.author: Everything Grey Greyhound Haven

customer_reviews.title: As advertised!
customer_reviews.text: This product thus far seems to be exactly as advertised. Quite frankly, I purchased it for the mopping ability as I already had another similar product for vacuuming but this does equally as well with both functions. I am not dissatisfied with this product at all. It certainly does not replace scrubbing for very dirty floors but does the trick for the kitchen/bathroom as long as you use it a couple times/week.
customer_reviews.author: Steve Y.

customer_reviews.title: Update - Great, great product:  STILL trongly recommend this little cleaning bot
customer_reviews.text: Update Dec 2019: I've bought a couple of these bots now, for friends. I've had mine for over two years now. It still runs really well, and after two years, I still am amazed at how much dirt, dust and hair it picks up when the floors don't at first seem terribly dirty. Super product. I didn't know what to expect. This little vacuum has done a really good job of getting dust, dirt and cat hair off of our hardwood floors. The filter is stuffed (!) with hair, dust bunnies and whatnot. I can't recommend this highly enough!
customer_reviews.author: Reviewer

customer_reviews.title: Pleasently surprised
customer_reviews.text: I was surprised at how well this vacuum travels throughout the entire house without direction or mapping. It did tend to run into a few items but it would just spin itself back around and find another way to go, even under my kitchen table with the chairs down, I did not think it would even run around all the chair legs, but it did. The first time it ran, I thought it would stop after 1 hour, but it kept on going until it was almost out of charge, then found its way back to the charging dock and parked itself. Im pretty impressed.
customer_reviews.author: LOWES Admin

customer_reviews.title: great cat hair and dust bunny sweeper
customer_reviews.text: Bought for my daughter for her birthday. She uses it constantly and she loves it! It does a great job and does stop at the top of the stairs. I'm impressed with it. Its not overly loud either. I'd buy again for a gift or even myself. And the color was pretty too. So far, seems to be great quality. I liked the reviews, compared to the Rumba. I'd buy this make again!
customer_reviews.author: Gma Gabble

customer_reviews.title: mildy decent vacuum, horrible mopping, wont return to charging base EVER
customer_reviews.text: Suction power isn't too bad but doesnt pick up particles any bigger then maybe a grain of rice. Mopping is a joke even with pre wetting the pad. Most frustrating is the vacuum NEVER returns to gome base when i push the button. Wanders aimlessly until I pick it up and put it directly in front of base and small chance it even does then. Not the best by a long shot
customer_reviews.author: Paige

customer_reviews.title: Works great!
customer_reviews.text: This vacuum was bought for me by my husband as a a Christmas gift bc I had been begging for one to help me out with my housework. It works great!! Picks up way more than I expected. But it gets tangled up in cords and basically anything that could be in the floor. We have 4 kids at home so I think for us it isn’t going to work unless I could make sure every kid never leaves a backpack or something in the floor. Lol. So I had to return. Maybe I can get one when my kids are grown.
customer_reviews.author: Jennifer Lambert

customer_reviews.title: Piece of S...........
customer_reviews.text: Worked well for 3 months and after that started to get stuck everywhere. It gets stuck around chairs and tables and never find the base back. I have a Roomba on the other floor. Its more expensive but has been working everyday for the last 4 years like good Cylon should do. Go with Roomba. Don't even consider an Ilife. Chineses stuff........
customer_reviews.author: Chris737

customer_reviews.title: Died after a few months of light use!!!
customer_reviews.text: I LOvED this vacuum at first! I got it 6 months ago/in August. But the last two weeks its been squeaking and stopping and I cannot figure out why. I clean it with every use and only use it on wood floors. Today: it died. :( I JUST bought a pack of filters too-so frustrating!! Unfortunately when i contacted Amazon -they said they cant do anything bc the return window ended in September. So i am out of luck. Very upsetting. I do NOT recommend.
customer_reviews.author: Mom of 3 Girls

customer_reviews.title: Not great for long haired people. :-\
customer_reviews.text: We have had this a little over a month, & it's great for dust & dog hair, but not cat litter. If you have anyone in your house with long hair, I don't recommend this, unless you want to replace the brushes after every use. They grab long hair, & it gets twisted up in the brushes, & bends them all up, which means they are no longer sweeping the floor. Cat litter just gets flung around, you're better off with a traditional vacuum for that. I also have to move area rugs, because it doesn't seem to do well on any type of carpet. On the plus side, it's fairly quiet.
customer_reviews.author: M. Dunning

customer_reviews.title: must have. it saves so much time.
customer_reviews.text: this thing is just like a washing machine. a must have for house keeping. I have a long hair dog which does shed. one charge equals to 3 hours cleaning and most of the time it will go back to its base by itself. I just need to empty the dust tray and clean the filter/housing. I change the disposable filter every month and clean the rotary bristles maybe twice a month. It probably doesn't clean as well as a handheld vacuum but I am happy it can does the vacuum for me so I don't have to do it. A much have!
customer_reviews.author: sweetteeth

customer_reviews.title: Not worth it!
customer_reviews.text: Was not a good purchase. It has no clue where its going. Maybe better for small houses since it has no mappimg capabilites. It grts stuck everywhere and I was afraid to let it go without constant supervision. Roomba is better! Also the mopping feature doesn't work and more of a pain than its worth. This dang robot got stuck in typical grout line!
customer_reviews.author: Melissa

customer_reviews.title: Best Friends when working, mortal enemies after first issue.
customer_reviews.text: This was my second iLife robot vacuum - and like the first, this died about 10 months after its first use. When it works, I adore it, it’s my best friend. But once little issues start popping up, beware, it will die in a matter of days. Mind began occasionally going backwards while running, then eventually would only go backwards, beep, and then just turn itself off. Tried to clean the eye, make sure it could rotate fully and that did nothing.
customer_reviews.author: Ashlyn

customer_reviews.title: So far I am very happy with this product!
customer_reviews.text: So far I'm really happy with this product. It picks up the pet hair and fine dirt very well on my wood floors floors and tile. It does not like throw rugs very well, (it bunches them up sometimes trying to go over them) but it's no big deal to pick those up. I feel like it saves me a lot of regular vacuuming and my floors are much cleaner. The filters are easy to empty and replace if needed. I haven't tried the mopping feature yet. It's so nice to let the beetle do its thing so I can do other stuff!! :) Money well spent!! (and half the price of the basic Roomba!)
customer_reviews.author: Abbie

customer_reviews.title: Alright subject to your expectations
customer_reviews.text: It's ok but definitely doesn't replace you actually hovering. Very random manages to miss loads just because of it's very random directions. Constantly seems to get stuck and need rescuing. Struggles to find it's way back to Its home. Its handy to reduce pet hair and kind of fun but not what I had hoped.
customer_reviews.author: Emi23

customer_reviews.title: ILIFE V5s Pro, 2-in-1 Mopping, doesn't mop, it "weeps"
customer_reviews.text: Purchased for the "Mopping function", ILIFE V5s Pro, 2-in-1 Mopping, doesn't mop, it "weeps" water from behind and eventually maybe gets back to it to drag it around. Spent most of its time in a corner making a puddle. Returned and will save until I can afford a real "Mopping Vacuum".
customer_reviews.author: VPO

customer_reviews.title: Better than nothing
customer_reviews.text: It is okay, it does not do as good of a job as I had hoped. I thought it would go back to its charging station when it needed a charge but, it does not. The one I got I don't think was a new one anyway. It looked like it had been repackaged. I have a couple of the mint robots that use Swiffer clothes that will pick up much more than this vacuum will. They cost a lot less too.
customer_reviews.author: B. ColemanTop Contributor: Pets

customer_reviews.title: time saver.
customer_reviews.text: great find for those busy working around the house but want vacuuming done too. allowed for study time to be uninterrupted. non-mapping and it shows, aka will vacuum same area 5-6 times and skip the one spot that has particles, then leave the area. other than that and the inability to get over anything taller than 1/4", it was a timer saver
customer_reviews.author: Darthanjealous

customer_reviews.title: Awesome, We all hardwood flooring and two cats
customer_reviews.text: Awesome, We all hardwood flooring and two cats. This cleans great. The MAX setting works nicely on the two area rugs. It tries to climb furniture with an angled base, but backs up on its own. Navigates beautifully. I tend to shut it in a room at a time, but i let it run thru the whole house a couple times. Ran for about 3.5 hrs. I empty it every half hr to depending. The mop feature is nice if you wet the pad first.
customer_reviews.author: darstsar

customer_reviews.title: Time saver.
customer_reviews.text: I got this product for my boyfriend that always seemed to be tracking sand into his house and was spending too much time sweeping and mopping. He loves his new helper and can spend his time on better things like hanging out with me. One thing he mentioned it has been a work in progress getting cords out of the way so it doesn't get stuck, but he said it moves seamlessly from the tile over throw rugs and the like. It did try to escape one day when he left the door open, but the 3 inch step was enough to hang it up and it shut itself off.
customer_reviews.author: Joellen kane

customer_reviews.title: It does a great job cleaning
customer_reviews.text: First time owner of a robotic vacuum. The first few times using this vacuum “maps” out the house. It does a great job cleaning. I run this vacuum 2-3 times a week always when I am home. Parts of my house are uneven for most part this vacuum does well. If the device is unable to move It will beep to let you know it’s entered sleep mode: as I continue to use this device I’m sure the “map” will continue to improve.
customer_reviews.author: J Hastings

customer_reviews.title: Best purchase of the year!!
customer_reviews.text: I have put off buying one of these for so long: I finally got one. I LOVE this!! It works great, it is pretty quiet, doesn’t get stuck, transfers from ceramic tile floors to carpeted rooms very easily- I love it !!!! It is Easy to clean. I am looking forward to popping on the mop pad and giving that a go this weekend! So far this thing is great!!
customer_reviews.author: D. FOXX

customer_reviews.title: Decent. Does what I want well but might not be suited for picky people.
customer_reviews.text: It’s a Chinese roomba. Does great for most things but I have issues with the timer going off and the manual is useless. Mop feature works decent and does okay on the small carpet areas. Easy to set up, easy to clean, but the drone is not intelligent. Just hits stuff turns and keeps going. If you’re expecting roomba quality don’t buy something this cheap. If you want something to vacuum for you on a budget this is a great product.
customer_reviews.author: Nick Dobben

customer_reviews.title: This product has changed our lives.
customer_reviews.text: I have a German Sheperd and West Hoghlend Terrier. Both dogs shed horrobly. We have a one story and only the bedrooms are carpet. Rest of the hise is wood and tile. We were going crazy trying to keep up with all the shedded hair. Then I came accross this life saving invention. We simply empty the chamber on a daily basis and our house is as if we no longer have dogs that shed. Thank you for having such a wonderful product. Has truly changed our lives.
customer_reviews.author: Jimmy Smith

customer_reviews.title: Easy set up
customer_reviews.text: I have only used it once but I bought it because my daughter has it and she particularly likes it so I'm excited to have one myself now she has a very large open area and I have several smaller rooms but it did manage to move from room to room
customer_reviews.author: MRSJJJ

customer_reviews.title: Good for all carpet or all hard surface
customer_reviews.text: It works fine on the vacuum setting and it surprisingly does a nice job on the hard surface floors. The problem we have is our kitchen/living area is all open and the living area is carpet, so when we run the hard surface mop feature, we have to block off the carpeted area otherwise it goes there. It would be nice if it had a small sensor we could turn on or off as needed for carpet.
customer_reviews.author: Shannon Lewis

customer_reviews.title: Good for dog owners
customer_reviews.text: I don’t really use the mop feature because it doesn’t go in straight rows, but it works really well for keeping the dog hair under control in our house! Every once in a while I have to cut away long hairs (mine) because they get tangled around the bristles, but it works well. The battery life isnt super great and the tank fills up pretty quick but that’s probably because we have LOTS of hair in our home 😆
customer_reviews.author: Alyssa Colvin

customer_reviews.title: Great price and great product!
customer_reviews.text: I am very impressed with the robot vacuums! I purchased 2 for both levels of my home. The vacuums pick up the dust, hair and animal fur, including anything else in its path. It maneuvers well over carpet too. I haven't tried the wet cleaners yet but I am looking forward to it. :) great price for a great product.
customer_reviews.author: Janea

customer_reviews.title: Great little robot vac!
customer_reviews.text: I bought this to replace my roomba that is on its last leg and i have to say it picked up way more dirt than my roomba has in a long time, maybe ever.....and is SO much quieter!! I love it. I havent used the mopping feature yet, but, im excited to try it out. It even docked itself after the first use. Im pretty impressed considering it was half the cost of my roomba.
customer_reviews.author: AB

customer_reviews.title: Didn't use it, wanted mop with vacuum.  Will try Ilife 400 if Scooba can't be repaired.
customer_reviews.text: I didn't use the machine. I wanted a mop that would draw the water off the floor. When I read that the "fan" or vacuum turned off with the mop attachment, I repacked it. But this is the third Ilife I have bought for myself. I have been so happy with them I have given 3 away as presents to friends and family. I have the Ilife 4 & 6. Love them.
customer_reviews.author: Tom Atkins

customer_reviews.title: Works well for the price
customer_reviews.text: Overall the vacuum picks up a lot of dirt and seems to work fairly well. The only real issue is that it doesn’t seem to be very intelligent when it comes to getting itself stuck and repeatedly going over the same areas. All in all you get what you pay for compared to the more expensive options out there.
customer_reviews.author: Elizabeth

customer_reviews.title: Amazing if you have mainly hardwood in your home
customer_reviews.text: I have the perfect storm for this unit. Since there isn't a roller I'm sure that it wouldn't be amazing on carpet. I have all hardwood and a fluffy cat. The open suction is very, very strong and the bristles bring the debris directly to the suction mouth. As a result it does a great job in my house. The mop feature is also very helpful and does a great job
customer_reviews.author: Elias

customer_reviews.title: Shipping was great and on time
customer_reviews.text: Shipping was great and on time. I had to use some YouTube video’s for instructions as the instructions it came with were hard for me to understand. Cleans the house because it gets full of dust, but still leaves some dirt around. It’s seems like it’s throwing pieces inforntbof it so it will vacuum the pieces later on, but it mostly throw th pieces underneath our couch. The wading function is nice but I wish it would of pressed harder on the floor to get better results.
customer_reviews.author: Rosbruch

customer_reviews.title: Awesome for pet owners
customer_reviews.text: Absolutely love this little robot! I bought an earlier model a few years back and fell in love with it. We have four dogs and it saves me tons of time to just turn it on once a day to collect hair or debris. I love that this mopping version came out. I use them back to back every day!
customer_reviews.author: Dawn

customer_reviews.title: Love this brand the best!
customer_reviews.text: It’s my second ILIFE robot. This is my first one with mopping function and I haven’t tried that part yet, but just the vacuum picked up so much, dare I say GD impressive, even with the smaller canister than the vacuum-only. I bought a different brand on Cyber Monday and hate it so much they’re letting me return it without original box or packaging. It does dirt, dog hair and pig hair (amazing, I know). It does tend to leave a little dirt when transitioning to rug (which it also cleans), but I’m chalking that up to a first-world problem. 😍💕
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Came with a defective battery, and doesn't work correctly. Total waste of money.
customer_reviews.text: I've heard so many great things about this robot vacuum. We've had it about 2 months, and have followed the instructions to the letter. It was perfect at first then about 3 weeks ago, it started to not pick up as much. For the last couple of weeks after being on the charger a full day, we turn it on, it lights up like normal then begins. Once it begins vacuuming, the lights change showing it has a low battery. It runs about 10 mins, then returns to the docking station. We charge it a whole day, and the same thing happens. It's very disappointing.
customer_reviews.author: Robyn Johnson

customer_reviews.title: Very frustrating experience
customer_reviews.text: The unit worked fine for about 10 runs, over about 2 months, and then it started acting up. Pressing the CLEAN button does nothing and the remote control is also useless. While at the base, the unit would wake up occasionally, beep, and shut back down. As a design choice by the manufacturer, this model has no means to display back some sort of error or status code to show where it is stuck, and it also has no exposed hardware reset button to be reset back to "time zero" its internal program. Overall a very frustrating experience with no means to understand what's wrong nor means to fix it.
customer_reviews.author: GT

customer_reviews.title: Really cool.
customer_reviews.text: Coolest thing we’ve bought. We have robo vacuums. We just bought this for the mop feature. Just fill with hot water and go. Some spots we had to pre-treat with a floor cleaner. But, that consists of spraying the spot and letting the mop wipe it up. Really cool. We do not use it for vacuuming.
customer_reviews.author: David G.

customer_reviews.title: LOVE, LOVE, LOVE MY ILIFE
customer_reviews.text: I had a Roomba for many years, before most knew what they were. It was expensive so didn't talk about it...but when I saw how affordable floor vacuums have become and how much better they are, I gave the roomba to my daughter and bought the ILIFE. In fact I bought 2 others after getting mine, one for another daughter and one for my sister. I told my friend and she bought one... We will never vacuum again, the old fashion way! I use mine every day, you won't be sorry. Watch for the sales I got one for only $132.00 including a discount that popped up on Amazon.
customer_reviews.author: John DeBoo

customer_reviews.title: Buy Roborock or Roomba instead.
customer_reviews.text: I live outside of US. Mine came without the mop holder si it is more expensive to me to return it than to use it as is. I will try to buy it though as a spare. The fact that it does the cleaning randomly does not guarantee that it will clean all the spot it is physically able to reach. I should have bought the Roomba or Roborock. They map all the area and /or memorize it. I will buy them eventually.... more soon than later ... It has good absorption power, but again, it does the cleaning randomly which is not efficient.
customer_reviews.author: Claudia Gabirondo

customer_reviews.title: very random pattern to vacuum
customer_reviews.text: it's not as smart as I thought. It kind of run through the room in a very random paytern and it took it a long time to pick up every spot. but it did go though the whole first floor after all. a newer model shall do a better job. I haven't tried out the mopping function yet so can't comment on that.
customer_reviews.author: Sammi H.

customer_reviews.title: Hard to beat for the money
customer_reviews.text: It cleans slightly better than the iRobot Braava 380t ($250), but it's not the Scooba replacement I was hoping for. That being said, for the money, it's tough to beat. I didn't use the non-mopping function, but I cannot imagine that it works well given it lacks brushes. As for a mopping function, it's a glorified Swifter WetJet that runs for hours. Pros: -Cheap for a Roomba-like vacuum. -Easy to use -Really long run time -Works pretty well Cons: -The mop attachment can fall off or get stuck when it encounters some inclines -The V5s likes to get trapped under my fridge door
customer_reviews.author: CM

customer_reviews.title: Not 100% Happy
customer_reviews.text: I liked it the first and only time I could get it to work. It's very quiet and has a long battery life. I could not get it to charge again or stop beeping. There was nothing about that in the manual, I had to watch You Tube videos and could not resolve the issues - total waste of my time. I'm returning it. I had some friends on FB swear by it - sadly I cannot.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: DON'T BUY THIS, THIS IS A SCAM CHINESE PRODUCT
customer_reviews.text: THIS PRODUCT WAS AMAZING FOR 10 MONTHS. DOESN'T WORK AFTER THAT. THE WARRANTY IS A SCAM. DON'T BUY SUCH A CHEAP CHINESE PRODUCT. BETTER BUY A US PRODUCT IF YOU ARE LIVING IN USA. DON'T FALL FOR THESE CHEAP CHINESE PRODUCTS BY THE PRICE.
customer_reviews.author: Chaks

customer_reviews.title: Don't buy for the mopping feature
customer_reviews.text: This should not be called a vacuum/mop vac. The mopping feature gives you a little tiny pad and you can only use water. It might as well not mop at all, because stains or anything else as a matter of fact, do not get cleaned up at all. I do like that it is quiet and brings itself back to the charger.
customer_reviews.author: Chocolate Queen

customer_reviews.title: Great value!!
customer_reviews.text: In my experience it does great I hardwoods/laminate/tile. It doesn’t have the auction to really do a fantastic job on carpets but definitely can suck up the top layer. I really like the welp mop or dry mop option. It’s nice to vacuum then lock it in the kitchen to wet mop everything. It really takes care of the weekly cleaning so you only have to do the deep cleaning every so often. I have recommended this model to many of my friends.
customer_reviews.author: Tristan

customer_reviews.title: Can't be more happy 😊
customer_reviews.text: Can't be more happy!!! I do not have enough time to clean the house by my self. I work and study. Also I have two dogs. I program it to start cleaning at 1:00am. Oh boy! In the morning the floor was beautiful. I cut the hair of my dogs (Schnauzers) while I was doing it I left the machine on, after I finish cutting their hair I just had to clean the table. This machine is not an expense this is an investment 😎👍.
customer_reviews.author: il

product_meta.title: ILIFE V5s Pro, 2-in-1 Mopping,Robot Vacuum, Slim, Automatic Self-Charging Robotic Vacuum, Daily Schedule, Ideal for Pet Hair, Hard Floor and Low Pile Carpet.
feature_bullets: 2-IN-1 SWEEPING AND MOPPING: Sweeping system provides a powerful suction in vacuum mode. Mopping system with intelligent control water tank. One Robot, Two option.
ENHANCED MOTOR:Quiet, but still powerful.It can easily and efficiently collect debris, hair, dust and dirt.
UNIQUE SUCTION INLET: The unique suction structure ensures that pet hair and dirt go into the dustbin easily which makes the V5s pro great for pet owners.
ENDURANCE CLEANING: Lasts up to 110 minutes of work, automatically docks and charges, and is always prepare to clean the floor.

What you get: 1 Robot ，1 Remote Control(2 AAA Battery Included)，2 filter，1 AC Adapter（About 1.5m length，1 Charging Base，1 Cleaning Brush，2 Side Brushes，1 Water tank ，1 Mop holder(With 1 mop)，，User's Quick Guide，User's manual.AND A 12-month warranty and U.S. customer service team provides you with peace of mind and timely service. Any questions, call 1-800-631-9676 from 9:00am-5:00pm CST, Monday-Friday.

specifications.Customer Reviews: 4.1 out of 5 stars2,648 ratings4.1 out of 5 stars
specifications.Warranty Description: Manufacturer provide 1 year warranty from purchasing date.
specifications.Included Components: 1 ILIFE V5s Pro, 1 water tank, 2 mop, 1 remote control
